conclusion: Rod OA is vertical
Rod OB makes a 45° angle with OA
Rings E and F can move freely on rods OA and OB
Mass m is suspended at point D by a light rope
We need to find F₁ (force between ring E and rod OA) and F₂ (force between ring F and rod OB)
Identify all forces in the system and apply static equilibrium conditions
Weight of the object: mg (downward)
Tension in the ropes DE and DF
Reaction forces F₁ and F₂ between rings and rods
Weight mg acting downward at point D
Tension T₁ along direction DF
Tension T₂ along direction DE
Tension T₂ from the rope (direction from E to D)
Normal force F₁ perpendicular to rod OA (horizontal)
Tension T₁ from the rope (direction from F to D)
Normal force F₂ perpendicular to rod OB

premise: Since the rings can move freely, the tensions in the ropes must be perpendicular to the rods.
conclusion: T₂ is horizontal (perpendicular to OA) and T₁ is at -45° from the horizontal (perpendicular to OB)
Coordinate system: y-axis is vertical (upward positive), x-axis is horizontal (rightward positive)
T₂ - T₁·cos(45°) = 0
T₂ = T₁·cos(45°) = T₁/√2
